page.title: 16CORNISH LANGUAGE PLACE NAMES
page.content: Many of the places in our survey area have names which are derived from the Cornish language.This often helps to explain the origins of the village or settlement or describes the natural features of the landscape or some special association with a person or event. Some of the place names are still in the Cornish language,while others are in English,usually in a corrupt form.Despite the efforts of many people in recent years,Cornish remains a language mainly for antiquarians and is only commonly seen in the place names throughout the area.On the next page of text we have recorded a list of some of the place names in our survey area, together with their meanings.
